alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 8:16PM AKST until December 12 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 4 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 18 inches. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From 11 AM Sunday to 4 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and afternoon commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin Sunday afternoon across much of the Matanuska Valley. The heaviest snow is currently expected from Sunday evening through Monday morning before gradually diminishing Monday afternoon. Highest snowfall totals look to be generally north and east of Sutton and from Wasilla westward.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
